00037 /**
00038  * \file lsdynaioP.h
00039  * \brief Private declarations for \ref LSDynaFileIO module.
00040  *
00041  * $Source: /usr/local/Repositories/fcdmf/fclib/modules/lsdynaioP.h,v $
00042  * $Revision: 1.17 $ 
00043  * $Date: 2006/09/15 22:09:36 $
00044  */
00045 
00046 #ifndef _FC_LS_DYNA_IO_P_H_
00047 #define _FC_LS_DYNA_IO_P_H_
00048 
00049 #ifdef __cplusplus
00050 extern "C" {
00051 #endif
00052 
00053 /**
00054  * \ingroup LSDynaFileIO
00055  * \brief Struct hold info about the file format for dataset.
00056  * 
00057  * \description
00058  *
00059  *    Need to keep word size and endian-ness.
00060  *
00061  *    It would be more aesthetically pleasing to put the vertIDs
00062  *    in each mesh, but if put here, it is easier to manage 
00063  *    cleaning up the dynamic memory. Ditto for conns_chunks
00064  *
00065  * \modifications
00066  *    - 7/17/2005 WSD Created.
00067  */
00068 typedef struct {
00069   int wordlen;       /**< size of units to be read from database */
00070   int doEndianSwap;  /**< flag for whether to flip bits or not */
00071   int numTotalVert;   /**< number of global vertices */
00072   // Coords info is in here since it is really global and not per mesh
00073   int coordsFileNum;  /**< number postfix for file (don't use if 0). */
00074   long coords_offset; /**< offset to start of coords */
00075   long conns8_offset; /**< offset to start of conns for solids (3D) */
00076   long conns4_offset; /**< offset to start of conns for shells (2D) */
00077   long conns2_offset; /**< offset to start of conns for beams (1D) */
00078   int numMesh;        /**< the number of meshes (need to dealloc memory) */
00079   int** vertIDs;      /**< for each mesh, the global vertex IDs 
00080                 (index by local ID) */
00081   int* numElemChunks; /**< for each mesh, the number of chunks that the
00082                 conns/elem_data are stored in */
00083   int** startElemPerChunk; /** for each mesh, for each chunk, the offset to
00084                       the chunk (in # of elements--will usually have 
00085                       to multiply by # of whatevers for that element 
00086                       to step through conns/elem_data arrays) */
00087   int** numElemPerChunk; /** for each mesh, for each chunk, the number
00088                      of elements in that chunk */
00089 } _FC_DsLSDynaIOInfo;
00090 
00091 /**
00092  * \ingroup LSDynaFileIO
00093  * \brief Struct hold info about the file format for mesh.
00094  * 
00095  * \description
00096  *
00097  *    Need to keep offset to topology and global IDs.
00098  *
00099  *    NOTE: We also keep the mesh's part or material ID, but this is stored up
00100  *    a level on the mesh's fileInfo object so that it can be retained when
00101  *    writing to a different file.
00102  *
00103  * \modifications
00104  *    - 7/18/2005 WSD Created.
00105  */
00106 typedef struct {
00107   int meshID;         /**< id to look up vertIDs */
00108 } _FC_MeshLSDynaIOInfo;
00109 
00110 /**
00111  * \ingroup LSDynaFileIO
00112  * \brief Struct hold info about the file format for variable.
00113  * 
00114  * \description
00115  *
00116  *    Need to keep filename, offset to data. Also info to decode "striped"
00117  *    data. (Striped = all data written for 1st element, then all data written
00118  *    for next element; non striped would have single data written for all
00119  *    elements, then next data written for all elements).
00120  *
00121  *    Set buffer size is o.k. because root names are limited to 75 char.
00122  *
00123  * \modifications
00124  *    - 7/18/2005 WSD Created.
00125  */
00126 typedef struct {
00127   int dataFileNum;     /**< number postfix for file (don't use if 0). */
00128   long data_offset;    /**< offset to start of data */
00129   // for vertex variables
00130   int doDispl;         /**< flag for whether to calc displacement */
00131   // for element variables
00132   int isStriped;       /**< if non-zero, this is the stride size
00133                (i.e. the number of data values for each elem) */
00134   int stripeID;        /**< the ID of the value of interest (e.g. has
00135                to be between 0 and isStriped-1) */
00136 } _FC_VarLSDynaIOInfo;

00150 FC_ReturnCode _fc_readLSDynaVariableData(FC_Variable variable);

00153 // NO file write & never will be
00154

00156 FC_ReturnCode _fc_closeLSDynaDataset(FC_Dataset dataset);

00161 #ifdef __cplusplus
00162 }
00163 #endif
